Why: Design and analysis of RNA-seq data. Establishment of bioinformatic workflows (prediction of MHC-binding peptides, protease cleavage sites, RNA secondary structure). Train ML models to highlight protein features explaining experimental observations.

My main project focused on study the likely association between mutations at cis-regulatory regions and dysregulation the miRNA networks. Besides this project, I co-lead two releases of the JASPAR database working on the clustering of motifs, data curation, and establishing a motif discovery pipeline. Supervisor: Anthony Matelier.
Graduated with honors. Thesis supervised by PhD Julio Collado-Vides and PhD Alejandra Medina-Rivera
